# activate(from:options:)

**Instance Method**

Attempts to activate the application using the specified options.

## Declaration

```swift
func activate(from application: NSRunningApplication, options: NSApplication.ActivationOptions = []) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **application**: The application to activate.
- **options**: The options to use during activation.

## Return Value

Returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the request is allowed by the system, otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

Use this method to request app activation. Calling this method doesn’t guarantee app activation. For cooperative activation, the other application should call [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/yieldActivation(to:)] or equivalent prior to the target application invoking [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/activate()].

## Activating applications

- **activate(options:)**: Attempts to activate the application using the specified options.
- **isActive**: Indicates whether the application is currently frontmost.
- **NSApplication.ActivationOptions**: The following flags are for [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSRunningApplication/activate(options:)].
- **activationPolicy**: Indicates the activation policy of the application.
- **NSApplication.ActivationPolicy**: Activation policies (used by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSRunningApplication/activationPolicy]) that control whether and how an app may be activated.
